duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide patient care and support activities promoting patient focused care within the Specialty Service.
Assist registered nurse in patient care activities, such as assisting patients with activities of daily living, collecting specimens, and performing procedures.
Maintain a safe, clean environment and perform clinical procedures such as specimen collection, venipuncture, and EKG.
Assist patients with activities of daily living, feeding, bathing, toileting, and ambulation.
Assist with dietary functions, delivering patient trays, and reporting variation in eating patterns to RN/Dietitian.
Perform patient observations and maintain isolation status for patients as directed by an RN.
Perform rounding on patients with emphasis on caring for toileting needs, comfort, and pain awareness.
Maintain supplies and care of equipment, participate in performance improvement activities, and observe compliance policies.
Participate in the development of other staff members, maintain patient/employee confidentiality, and meet regulatory, licensure, and annual health assessment requirements.
Demonstrate professional, courteous, and respectful attitude in dealing with patients, families, and colleagues.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma (graduate or equivalent) and Certificate of completion of a medical assistant/patient care assistant program/equivalent with skills in venipuncture and EKG. American Heart Association Heartsaver. BLS Certification accepted.
